item.title: The truth about idea stealing - Crew blog
item.description:
The truth about idea stealing - Crew blog

So many of us start the new year bursting with new product and business ideas. Yet, after asking my personal network if they'd share their ideas publicly, one question kept coming up: How will I protect my idea from being stolen? Why does everyone think their ideas will be stolen?

item.title: Don't create a sense of urgency, foster a sense of purpose.
item.description:
Don't create a sense of urgency, foster a sense of purpose.

Trying to create a sense of urgency almost always backfires. I lead software teams. Part of the territory is people (CEOs, stakeholders, customers) wishing we could go faster. I'm often asked - " do you think the team has a strong enough sense of urgency?" or the direct "can you make the team feel a stronger sense of urgency?"

item.title: The Minimum and Viable - The Corporate Startup
item.description:
The Minimum and Viable - The Corporate Startup

Experimental and Mundane Realism The concept of the minimum viable product is now part of the popular lexicon within the lean startup movement. As with most terms that become over-used most people still misunderstand what an MVP really is. Since most people assume "lean" means cheap, they also assume the MVP means "crappy version of future product".

item.title: Your Brain Actually Works Better in Winter, According to Science
item.description:
Your Brain Actually Works Better in Winter, According to Science

February is basically no one's favorite month. By now, most of us are well and truly sick of winter, yet winter is far from done, continuing to torture us with nose-freezing temperatures and super short days. Given how unpleasant the weather can be, it makes sense to conclude that the season is only good for ski buffs and hibernation.

item.title: learn like a gamer
item.description:
learn like a gamer

Learning is the new literacy. Personal computers are just one example. We buy new ones every few years. Operating systems change. Programs change, get replaced, or become obsolete. But we often continue with the same habits until something goes wrong. Few us do the equivalent of 'looking under the hood'.

item.title: What Is Corporate Culture?
item.description:
What Is Corporate Culture?

At its worst, culture can be a drag on productivity. At its best, it is an emotional energizer that companies can use to gain a competitive advantage.

item.title: The Corporate Startup - The Corporate Startup
item.description:
The Corporate Startup - The Corporate Startup

A Market Risk R&D Lab At Leancamp Stuttgart, we had a number of interesting sessions. One session in particular focused on corporate accelerators as a means to help large enterprises develop innovative new products. A corporate accelerator would be similar to other accelerator programmes such as Y-Combinator and Tech Stars.

item.title: Emotional Intelligence Is Overrated
item.description:
Emotional Intelligence Is Overrated

Not long ago, the CEO of a sales company mentioned that he was spending millions of dollars to train his employees in emotional intelligence. He asked if it was possible to assess emotional intelligence during the interview process, which would allow him to hire salespeople who already excelled in this area.

item.title: In the last 10 minutes, Facebook made $149,400.
item.description:
In the last 10 minutes, Facebook made $149,400.

From Apple to Google, watch as the internet giants accumulate (or lose) wealth in real-time in this interactive visualization.

item.title: The 25 Characteristics of a Great Development Team - Scrum.org Community Blog
item.description:
The 25 Characteristics of a Great Development Team - Scrum.org Community Blog

Recently I wrote an article about the characteristics of a great Product Owner. It gave me the idea to do the same for the Development Team and Scrum Master. This blog post focuses on the Development Team; I'll describe the characteristics, skills and conditions. Great Development Teams... Pursue technical excellence.
